alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Laramie County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 4:46PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Kimball and southeastern Laramie Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 446 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pine Bluffs to 11 miles northeast of Carpenter to near Burns. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluffs, Burns, Panorama Point and Carpenter. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 383 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County
